message.content:
A cattle is a domesticated hoofed mammal that belongs to the family Bovidae. It is usually raised as livestock for meat, dairy products, and leather. 
Cattle have a large and heavy build, with mature bulls weighing up to 2,000 pounds. 
Their coat can vary in color from black, brown, white, or a mix of these colors, and their skin is tough and thick. 
Cattle have two curved horns that protrude from their heads which are used for defense or foraging. 
They have four sturdy and cloven hooves which allow them to move steadily on uneven surfaces. 
In the United States, cattle are often raised on large farms or ranches, but can also be found grazing in fields or pastures throughout the world. 
Their grazing and herding habits have shaped cultures and agriculture in many countries for centuries.
